deleted.description: true if the word has been removed. false means the word hasn't been removed because it was not in the dictionary.

added.description: true if the word has been added. false means the word hasn't been added because it had been added before.

mappings.name: Get a list of supported languages.

detectedLanguage.description: The automatically detected text language (might be different from the language actually used for checking).

language.description: The language used for checking the text.

length.description: The length of the error in characters in the context.

offset.description: The 0-based character offset of the error in the context text.

text.description: Context of the error, i.e. the error and some text to the left and to the left.

length.description: The length of the error in characters.

message.description: Message about the error displayed to the user.

offset.description: The 0-based character offset of the error in the text.

replacements.description: Replacements that might correct the error. The array can be empty, in this case there is no suggested replacement.

id.description: A category's identifier that's unique for this language.

name.description: A short description of the category.

id.description: An rule's identifier that's unique for this language.

issueType.description: The Localization Quality Issue Type. This is not defined for all languages, in which case it will always be 'Uncategorized'.

subId.description: An optional sub identifier of the rule, used when several rules are grouped.

urls.description: An optional array of URLs with a more detailed description of the error.

sentence.description: The sentence the error occurred in (since LanguageTool 4.0 or later)

apiVersion.description: Version of this API response. We don't expect to make incompatible changes, so this can also be increased for newly added fields.

buildDate.description: Date when the software was built, e.g. '2016-05-25'.

premium.description: true if you're using a Premium account with all the premium text checks (since LanguageTool 4.2)

status.description: An optional warning, e.g. when the API format is not stable.
